parameters.text:
=collect trending hashtags from the given link below:
{{ $json.url }}

parameters.name: Content Calendar
parameters.description:
=Add trend score, source link, or notes for the following trending hashtags.

{{ $json.trending_hashtags }}

parameters.content:
## ✅ **📅 Section 1 — Start & Prepare**

**Nodes Combined:**

1. `📅 Daily Trigger`
2. `🛠️ Prepare Input`

### **🔍 What Happens Here?**

* **`📅 Daily Trigger`**: This node automatically starts your workflow every day (or any schedule you choose). You don’t need to run it manually — it works in the background like a virtual assistant.

  * *Why?* → You always get fresh, up-to-date trending hashtags.

* **`🛠️ Prepare Input`**: This node is your mini control center for customizing your request. You can edit or add any parameters that the AI agent will need — for example:

  * Which region you want to target.
  * Which platform (Twitter, TikTok, etc.).
  * Any custom keywords or filters.

👉 **Beginner Tip:** This is your chance to **fine-tune** what you want to scrape. You don’t need coding — just type values in the fields!

### 🎯 **Benefit:**

This section guarantees your workflow is *automatic* and *customized* — you never forget to gather new ideas!

---

## ✅ **🤖 Section 2 — Scrape & Parse**

**Nodes Combined:**

1. `🤖 Get Trending Hashtags`
2. `🕷️ Bright Data MCP`
3. `💬 OpenAI Model`
4. `🗂️ Parse Hashtag Data`

### **🔍 What Happens Here?**

* **`🤖 Get Trending Hashtags`**: This is your main **AI Agent**. It calls the **Bright Data MCP Client** to go out to the web and scrape trending hashtags from social platforms.

  * *Why?* → It does the heavy lifting so you don’t have to visit each site yourself!

* **`🕷️ Bright Data MCP`**: This tool is the **real scraper**. It navigates websites like a smart crawler, grabs trending hashtags, usage stats, and reach data.

* **`💬 OpenAI Model`**: (Optional but powerful) — if you want, you can use it to clean, format, or even enrich the hashtags with smart suggestions. Example: “Suggest a post idea for this hashtag.”

* **`🗂️ Parse Hashtag Data`**: Takes the raw scraped data (which can be messy) and turns it into structured, easy-to-use JSON format — clear, clean, and ready for Trello.

👉 **Beginner Tip:** This section is **your digital research team**. No coding. No manual scraping. You just connect it once.

### 🎯 **Benefit:**

You now have **fresh**, **structured**, **reliable** trending hashtags with stats — the exact fuel your marketing team needs for viral posts.

---

## ✅ **📋 Section 3 — Final Format & Save**

**Nodes Combined:**

1. `🔢 Convert Numbers to Strings`
2. `📋 Create Trello Cards`

### **🔍 What Happens Here?**

* **`🔢 Convert Numbers to Strings`**: A small but important **Code Node**. It changes the `uses` and `reach` numbers into **text**, so they don’t break your Trello card format.

  * *Why?* → Trello sometimes needs all fields as text to display nicely.

* **`📋 Create Trello Cards`**: The final node **automatically creates a new card** in your chosen Trello Board & List for each trending hashtag.

  * The card title can be the **hashtag name**.
  * The description can include:

    * 📊 Uses count
    * 🌍 Reach stats
    * 📝 Any notes or ideas

👉 **Beginner Tip:** Your social team just needs to open Trello → pick a hashtag → create content → done!

## 🎉 **💡 How a Beginner Can Use This**

✅ **No code needed**: Drag, drop, connect.
✅ **Automatic updates**: No manual copy-paste.
✅ **Endless ideas**: Your Trello stays filled with trending hashtags every single day.
✅ **Easy edits**: Want a new platform? Just update the `Prepare Input` node.
✅ **Instant scaling**: Add Slack or Email nodes to notify your team too!
